Message.Title: Benghazi could be Obama undoing, world newspapers say.
Message.Msg: Gardiner: 'White House’s Benghazi Bungling is Proving a Disaster' '...giving every impression that it is lacking in transparency, competence and accountability' With the liberal, old-guard media still in bed with the White House and the recent election behind them, Team Obama surely thought Benghazigate would be promptly buried and forgotten. Alas, it's really not working out that way, is it... The problem is that instead of forthcoming, good-faith disclosure -and perhaps some smidgen of accountability- the habitually-dishonest Obama Administration has been lying about Benghazi from the start: the cause, the circumstances on the ground, the perpetrators, what they knew and when they knew it, who's to blame for dismissal of security concerns at our consulate, Obama's initial reaction to the attack, etc. Dear Leader has also run the bus right over Hillary, Petraeus, and two top commanders in a shameful attempt to deflect blame for his own total and complete FAIL at Benghazi on 9/11/12, while orchestrating a cover-up so massive it makes Watergate look like some college prank. It all started with a cockamamie story re. Benghazi having something to do with a YouTube video and a protest that never happened. UN Ambassador Susan Rice was pushed out on the stage to promote this for four days straight, yet Gen. Petraeus recently made it clear the CIA knew it was AQ right away... and that they never bought into the 'protest' bit. Now that Obama himself, his Director of National Intelligence (DNI), and the State Dept have all distanced themselves from the 'video' fairy-tale as well -adding they 'don't know' who edited-out mention of Al Qaeda from the Benghazi talking-points- you have to wonder why Susan Rice was out hard-selling us a fictional, fatherless version of events nobody seems to have ever believed for a minute. Subsequent spray-painting of the turd has proved largely ineffectual. and now that Obama is attempting elevate that same toady Susan Rice to Secretary of State, her previous willingness to stand up and lie for this vile administration has brought the wrath of GOP lawmakers- it's about damn time they got #$%$ about something. An increasingly cornered Obama has slipped-into his standard default setting of 'only the Republicans care about this', but that's not fooling most thinking people anymore- including some on the other side of the pond: Daily Telegraph (UK): President Obama hasn’t even begun his second term yet, but his administration is already struggling with a huge credibility problem on the Benghazi front... Jay Carney told the assembled White House press corps: "...the president ... is not particularly concerned about whether the ambassador or I went out and talked about the fact that we believed extremists might have been responsible. And whether we named them as al Qaeda or not does not–no, it certainly doesn't have any bearing on what happened and who was responsible as that investigation was continuing on Benghazi." Carney’s response, as the president’s official spokesman is extraordinarily dismissive of the concerns of the American people as well as the United States Congress, and is representative of the administration’s shambolic handling of the Benghazi attack. Susan Rice is the US Ambassador to the United Nations and Obama’s likely choice to replace Hillary Clinton as Secretary of State. What she misleadingly told millions of Americans on national television regarding the circumstances surrounding the first assassination of a US Ambassador since 1979 is of great public interest, and the nation deserves clear answers about what exactly the president and his top advisers knew before, during and after the Benghazi atrocity, and how they responded... Already there's political observers thinking that an arrogant, damn-the-torpedoes nomination of Susan Rice for Secretary of State could be Barack Obama's political undoing... and this one's a Democrat. Plenty of questions left to answer about Benghazi and the (ongoing) Obama Administration cover-up, too- oh yeah.

Message.Title: When Bill Clinton left office and George W. Bush took over in 2001 there were budget surpluses that were projected to last till 2019
Message.Msg: When Bill Clinton left office and George W. Bush took over in 2001 there were budget surpluses that were projected to last till 2019, seven years from now! Clinton had cut domestic spending and increased military spending and had a booming economy to go along with his 2003 tax increase. There was no “excessive government spending” unless you want to count our bloated military budget. George W. Bush changed all of that by cutting taxes, mostly for the benefit of the top 5% of Americans and their companies, starting two costly wars, and running around the country raising campaign cash while the economy was manipulated and brought to its knees by the super wealthy to their limited advantage! Now here we are, but this is what the Neo-Conservatives have wanted all along – budget deficits large enough to force Congress, including Red State Congressmen who depend on federal spending programs, to cut domestic spending. Grover Norquist said in late 2000, after Bush was selected as President, that he wanted to shrink the federal government to the point it would fit into a bath tub, and then drown it! “Mission Accomplished,” even though it is not small enough to fit into a bath tub, it is drowning in red ink! However, the budget deficits during WW2, as a percentage of GDP, were over twice as high as current deficits and we did not collapse, even with a 91% top marginal income tax bracket on ALL income over $200,000 for individuals. We became the manufacturing champions of the world and we ran trade surpluses and became the world’s chief lender! Now, thanks to ‘free trade’, we run huge trade deficits which contribute to the budget deficits, and makes us a debtor nation instead of a lender. Bush and the rest of the Neo-Cons did not count on collapsing the economy in the process. The best way to get the deficit reduced is to put millions of Americans back to work in good paying jobs so that they are once again paying federal and state income taxes, and are buying things, but this won’t happen as long as the “job creators” (who most benefitted from Bush’s tax cuts) are still using ‘free trade’ to eliminate American jobs and the wages, health insurance premiums, retirement benefits, and Social Security matching they are required to pay in favor of Asian slave labor! Plus, we must raise the top tax brackets at least back to the 50% rate that existed at the end of Reagan’s first term! Apply that rate to all income over $10 million to compensate for inflation since WW2. Until Reagan, and then Bush Jr., cut the tax rates for the wealthiest Americans, business owners put company profits back into their companies or paid dividends to common stock holders to avoid paying high personal income taxes. With Bush’s tax cuts that is no longer a problem, so owners and CEOs now pay themselves a king’s ransom no matter how poorly their company is doing, because they pay no tax penalty for their extreme greed! We should cut corporate taxes to zero, since they lie, cheat, and steal to avoid their taxes anyway, and bring back the 70% top personal income tax bracket that existed when Reagan took office in 1981. Apply that bracket to all income over $100 million annual income and with no distinction between earned income from wages, and unearned income from capital gains, dividends, and rents! If the most greedy want to avoid paying taxes they could pay themselves less, pay their common stock holders and workers more. The rich would pay less income tax, the workers would pay more income taxes, and everyone plus our country would be better off! The penalty for tax evasion should then be prison or permanent deportation to wherever your money is stashed overseas!

Message.Title: Cisco buys another Software company
Message.Msg: Software is where the HIGHER margins are. Nov 29 (Reuters) - Cisco Systems Inc said it will buy privately held network traffic-management software maker Cariden Technologies Inc for about $141 million in cash. Cariden will be integrated into Cisco's service provider networking group unit, Cisco said. California-based Cariden supplies network planning, design and traffic management solutions for telecommunications service providers. This is Cisco's third acquisition in November. Earlier this month Cisco said it will buy privately held cloud networking company Meraki for $1.2 billion in cash as part of its cloud and networking strategy.

Message.Title: 4-Week-Average Jobless Claims At 13-Month High
Message.Msg: While any and every bad data point recently has been summarily dismissed by the 'transitory' effects of Hurricane Sandy, it appears in the deepest darkest reality that there is more of a structural trend to this shift than simply a 'blip'. Claims missed expectations and prior data was revised higher leaving the four-week-average at its highest since October 2011 jumping back over 400k. More critically, when we dig into the details on the DoL site, we find some rather disturbing trends that totally dismiss Sandy effects. For instance, according to the DoL, there were 30.6k fewer initial claims in New York Last week - when this higher aggregate data point is supposed to be due to 'Sandy'. FL, MI, and MA saw the largest increases in claims. It seems blaming this trend-break on Sandy is now a non-starter - fiscal cliff front-running perhaps? Election hangover?

Topic.Title: Update: The Village Bakery in Lawrenceville NJ CLOSING - obvious THIS IS OBAMA'S FAULT

Message.Msg: First Obama caused the hurricane and then he made the economy recover so there was no qualified staff available In a letter to friends and patrons dated Tuesday, owner Karen Child explains that the bakery on Gordon Avenue in Lawrence Township, in part, could not recover from losses incurred due to the power outage caused by Hurricane Sandy. To the shock and dismay of many Lawrence Township residents, The Village Bakery has gone out of business, closing its doors as of this morning (Tuesday, Nov. 27). In a letter dated today and posted on the door of the bakery – on Gordon Avenue in the heart of historic Lawrenceville – owner Karen Child explains that the decision to close the business was a difficult one that was the result of losses brought about by Hurricane Sandy and the difficulties she and her husband Bo had in finding qualified staff to help run the bakery.

Topic.Title: Obama Blamed Bush for everything, what you can't take it?

Message.Msg: Bush may have seemed larger than life for eight years, but he left a surprisingly thin legacy. Take his legislative agenda. No Child Left Behind is now widely unpopular among both liberals and conservatives—so unpopular that Congress has spent the past five years assiduously avoiding a vote to reauthorize it. His tax cuts expired in 2010 and are now little more than a political football. His own party wants to repeal key provisions of Sarbanes-Oxley. The Supreme Court has effectively gutted campaign finance reform. On the foreign policy front, his wars are widely viewed as expensive failures. And he was never able to get so much as a vote on Social Security privatization or immigration reform. That doesn't leave much. Pretty much all that's left is the PATRIOT Act and the Medicare prescription drug bill. That's not much for eight years. Beyond that, neither party wants anything to do with him. It's not surprising that Democrats still think of him as the Frat Boy President, one of the worst of all time, but what is surprising is that Republicans largely agree. But there's a bonus for the taxpayers children and grandchildren, he lwft them with a $3Trillion bill for his two precious wars and they are still counting, imagine paying all health bennies for 60-80 years for all these vets. Message.Title: Great day in history!!!
Message.Msg: The UN General Assembly has voted to grant the Palestinians non-member observer status - a move vehemently opposed by Israel and the US. Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas told the assembly the vote was the "last chance to save the two-state solution" with Israel. Israel's ambassador to the UN, Ron Prosor, said the bid "doesn't advance peace - it pushes it backwards". The assembly voted 138-9 in favour, with 41 nations abstaining.
